parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
Secretly, privately. Adverb from lanthano; privately.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
